name: Increase Fiber Intake
description: Fiber supports metabolic health, digestive function, and cardiovascular resilience. It helps the body eliminate excess cholesterol, regulates blood sugar, and promotes a healthier gut microbiome. Found in foods like oats, beans, flaxseed, and psyllium, soluble fiber is a foundational component of a longevity-supportive diet.
agent_goal: Increase daily fiber intake through whole foods

name: Prioritize Healthy Fats Over Saturated Fats
description: Swapping saturated fats for healthier fats like olive oil, avocados, nuts, and fatty fish supports heart and brain health, lowers systemic inflammation, and promotes metabolic balance. These fats are core components of dietary patterns linked to increased longevity and reduced chronic disease risk.
agent_goal: Prioritize healthy fats (olive oil, avocado, nuts, fish) over saturated fats
secondary_biometrics: Skeletal Muscle Mass to Fat-Free Mass

name: Incorporate Zone 2 Cardio for Mitochondrial and Cardiovascular Health
description: Zone 2 cardio involves sustained, moderate-intensity aerobic exercise that keeps your heart rate within a range that maximizes fat oxidation and mitochondrial efficiency. Training in this zone improves metabolic flexibility, insulin sensitivity, and cardiovascular resilience. It's foundational for longevity, endurance, and energy metabolism. You should be able to maintain conversation, but feel like you’re working.
agent_goal: Perform Zone 2 cardio (moderate intensity, conversational pace) regularly

name: Prioritize 7–9 Hours of Consistent Sleep for Recovery and Longevity
description: Consistently getting 7–9 hours of sleep supports cellular repair, metabolic regulation, hormonal balance, and cognitive performance. Sleep is when your body consolidates memory, clears neural waste, and recalibrates critical systems like immune response and glucose control. Building a foundation of sufficient sleep — and doing it consistently — is one of the most powerful longevity levers available.

name: Reduce or Eliminate Alcohol Consumption
description: Alcohol affects liver health, metabolic function, sleep quality, inflammation, and hormonal balance. For users with elevated GGT, ALT, hsCRP, or disrupted sleep, moderating or removing alcohol intake can lead to significant improvements in biomarker trends and subjective well-being over a 3–4 month protocol.

name: Increase Protein Intake
description: Protein is essential for building and maintaining lean muscle, supporting metabolic health, and promoting satiety. Regularly including high-quality protein sources in your meals enhances recovery, supports healthy aging, and helps maintain energy and body composition.
agent_goal: Increase protein intake to support muscle maintenance
primary_biometrics: Skeletal Muscle Mass to Fat-Free Mass

name: Increase Vegetable Intake
description: Regular vegetable intake supports metabolic health, cardiovascular resilience, and digestive function. Vegetables provide essential micronutrients, fiber, and phytonutrients linked to healthy aging, inflammation reduction, and chronic disease risk reduction.
agent_goal: Eat more vegetables daily for micronutrients and fiber

name: Increase Fruit Intake
description: Regular fruit intake provides essential vitamins, minerals, antioxidants, and fiber. Eating a variety of fruits supports metabolic health, immune function, healthy aging, and helps lower risk of chronic diseases.
agent_goal: Include fruits in daily diet for antioxidants and fiber

name: Reduce Added Sugar Intake
description: Added sugar contributes to metabolic dysfunction, inflammation, and increased chronic disease risk. Reducing daily added sugar improves energy, supports healthy weight, and protects long-term cardiometabolic health. For this recommendation, a serving is any food or drink with about 8–12g of added sugar (e.g., 1 cookie, sweetened yogurt, granola bar, or can of soda). If the item is over 15g, count as 2 servings.
agent_goal: Reduce added sugar and refined carbohydrate intake

name: Reduce Processed Meat Intake
description: High intake of processed meats is linked to increased cancer, cardiovascular, and metabolic disease risk. Reducing processed meat supports longevity and promotes healthier eating.
agent_goal: Reduce or eliminate processed meat consumption

name: Increase Whole Grain Intake
description: Whole grains are rich in fiber, vitamins, and minerals that support metabolic, digestive, and cardiovascular health. Regular intake is linked to longevity and reduced risk.
agent_goal: Choose whole grains over refined grains

name: Increase Legume Intake
description: Legumes provide plant-based protein, fiber, and micronutrients that promote metabolic, digestive, and cardiovascular health. Regular intake supports longevity and gut health.
agent_goal: Include legumes (beans, lentils) in diet regularly
secondary_biometrics: Skeletal Muscle Mass to Fat-Free Mass

name: Reduce Caffeine Intake
description: High caffeine intake (over 400mg/day) can disrupt sleep, increase anxiety, and impact blood pressure. Reducing intake supports better sleep, energy, and cardiometabolic health. 1 regular cup of coffee ≈ 100mg, 1 espresso ≈ 60–80mg, 1 energy drink ≈ 80–120mg, 1 cup of tea ≈ 40mg.

name: Optimize Caffeine Source
description: Certain sources of caffeine—like energy drinks, pre-workout supplements, and high-caffeine sodas—are associated with greater cardiovascular, anxiety, and metabolic risk. Replacing these with coffee or tea provides a gentler, more stable source of caffeine, along with antioxidant and metabolic benefits.

name: Optimize Caffeine Timing
description: Consuming caffeine late in the day can disrupt sleep, delay circadian rhythms, and reduce sleep quality. To support optimal sleep and energy, finish all coffee, tea, energy drinks, and other sources of caffeine by 2pm.

name: Daily Meal Frequency
description: Regular meal frequency supports stable energy, muscle maintenance, metabolic health, and balanced nutrient intake. Eating too few meals can increase fatigue and undernutrition risk.

name: Time Restricted Eating
description: Intermittent fasting with a daily eating window of 10 hours or less (14+ hours fasting) may support metabolic health, weight management, and circadian rhythms.
agent_goal: Practice time-restricted eating or intermittent fasting

name: First Meal Timing
description: Aligning the timing of your first meal with your natural circadian rhythm may improve metabolic health, energy levels, and blood sugar control.

name: Final Meal Timing
description: Eating your final meal well before bedtime supports digestion, sleep quality, and circadian health. Early final meal timing may improve blood sugar, fat metabolism, and reduce nighttime reflux or discomfort.

name: Daily Water Intake
description: Adequate hydration supports energy, metabolism, brain function, and healthy skin. Drinking enough water daily can improve mood, cognition, and overall well-being.

name: Daily Whole Food Meals
description: Emphasizing whole, minimally processed foods at meals supports metabolic health, lowers inflammation, and improves gut health and satiety.
agent_goal: Follow daily whole food meals recommendation

name: Daily Ultra-Processed Foods
description: Ultra-processed foods (e.g., packaged snacks, sweetened beverages, fast food) increase risk for metabolic disease and inflammation. Reducing intake supports long-term health.

name: Daily Takeout/Delivery Meals
description: Regular takeout or delivery meals, especially from fast food or chain restaurants, are often higher in calories, sodium, and unhealthy fats. Reducing takeout improves dietary quality and supports health.

name: Daily Plant-Based Meals
description: Plant-based meals support cardiovascular, metabolic, and gut health by increasing fiber, phytonutrients, and healthy fats while lowering inflammation.

name: Zone 2 Cardio Sessions
description: Zone 2 cardio—sustained, moderate-intensity aerobic activity—improves metabolic, mitochondrial, and cardiovascular health.
agent_goal: Perform Zone 2 cardio (moderate intensity, conversational pace) regularly

name: Daily Steps
description: Daily step count is a simple, powerful marker of physical activity and metabolic health. Increasing steps improves cardiovascular, cognitive, and overall health.
agent_goal: Walk daily to improve cardiovascular health

name: Strength Training Sessions
description: Strength training supports muscle, bone, and metabolic health, improves longevity, and reduces injury risk.
agent_goal: Perform strength training to maintain muscle mass and bone density
primary_biometrics: Skeletal Muscle Mass to Fat-Free Mass

name: Strength Training Duration
description: The total weekly time spent on strength training is a key driver for muscle adaptation and longevity.
agent_goal: Perform strength training to maintain muscle mass and bone density
primary_biometrics: Skeletal Muscle Mass to Fat-Free Mass

name: HIIT Sessions
description: HIIT improves aerobic/anaerobic fitness, insulin sensitivity, and heart health with time-efficient, intense intervals.
secondary_biometrics: Skeletal Muscle Mass to Fat-Free Mass

name: HIIT Duration
description: Short, focused HIIT bursts provide substantial cardiovascular and metabolic benefits.

name: Daily Active Time
description: Building more daily movement boosts mood, metabolism, heart health, and helps maintain a healthy weight. Active time is a core pillar of physical and mental resilience.

name: Sedentary Time
description: Reducing prolonged sitting lowers cardiometabolic and cognitive risk, improves posture, and supports more sustained energy throughout the day.

name: Weekly Mobility Sessions
description: Regular mobility sessions improve flexibility, joint health, and recovery—helping you move better and reduce injury risk as you get stronger.

name: Weekly Mobility Minutes
description: Short, frequent mobility work helps restore movement patterns, prevent stiffness, and builds a foundation for lifelong resilience.

name: Weekly Post-Meal Activity Minutes
description: Moving after meals improves blood sugar control, supports digestion, and can reduce cardiometabolic risk—especially when made a regular habit.
agent_goal: Follow weekly post-meal activity minutes recommendation

name: Weekly Post-Meal Activity Sessions
description: Frequent post-meal movement supports digestion and helps stabilize glucose—just a few sessions per week makes a difference.
agent_goal: Follow weekly post-meal activity sessions recommendation

name: Weekly Exercise Snacks
description: “Exercise snacks”—short bursts of movement—improve metabolic health, mood, and energy, and make movement more achievable in busy schedules.

name: Sleep Timing Consistency
description: Consistent bedtimes strengthen circadian rhythm, improve rest quality, and make mornings more predictable—key for resilience.
secondary_biometrics: Skeletal Muscle Mass to Fat-Free Mass

name: Wake Time Consistency
description: Consistent wake times anchor the circadian clock, support better sleep quality, and improve daily energy patterns.
secondary_biometrics: Skeletal Muscle Mass to Fat-Free Mass

name: Daily Early Morning Natural Light Exposure
description: Early natural light helps regulate your body clock, boost mood, and support healthy sleep.
agent_goal: Follow daily early morning natural light exposure recommendation

name: Large Meals ≤3 Hours Before Bed
description: Reducing late large meals helps support digestion, sleep quality, and metabolic health.
agent_goal: Follow large meals ≤3 hours before bed recommendation

name: Food Intake ≤2 Hours Before Bed
description: Avoiding all food close to bedtime supports restful sleep, digestion, and overnight recovery.
agent_goal: Follow food intake ≤2 hours before bed recommendation

name: Alcohol Intake ≤3-4 Hours Before Bed
description: Limiting alcohol before bed improves sleep quality, supports healthy metabolism, and reduces next-day grogginess.
agent_goal: Follow alcohol intake ≤3-4 hours before bed recommendation

name: Digital Device Time ≤2 Hours Before Bed
description: Reducing screen time before bed supports melatonin production, sleep onset, and better nightly rest.
agent_goal: Follow digital device time ≤2 hours before bed recommendation

name: Breathwork or Mindfulness Sessions
description: Breathwork and mindfulness can lower stress, support emotional health, and improve focus.

name: Social Interaction Events
description: Social events help strengthen relationships, build connection, and boost overall mental health.

name: Gratitude Practice
description: Gratitude practice builds resilience, positivity, and supports emotional well-being.

name: Journaling or Reflection Sessions
description: Journaling or reflection helps process emotions, clarify goals, and reduce stress.
agent_goal: Follow journaling or reflection sessions recommendation

name: Outdoor Time (minutes)
description: Outdoor time improves mood, focus, vitamin D, and overall well-being.

name: Morning Outdoor Time (minutes)
description: Morning outdoor time supports circadian rhythm, energy, and mood.

name: Digital Device Time (minutes)
description: Reducing non-work screen time supports better focus, healthier sleep patterns, and improved mental well-being. Non-work screen time refers to recreational or passive use of digital devices outside of job-related responsibilities—such as watching videos, scrolling social media, playing games, or browsing aimlessly.

name: Brain Training Activity (minutes)
description: Brain training supports cognitive health, focus, and lifelong learning.

name: Daily Social Interaction Time (minutes)
description: Daily social connection boosts mood, resilience, and cognitive health.

name: Daily Smoking (cigarettes)
description: Reducing smoking immediately improves cardiovascular and lung health.

name: Daily Brushing (times/day)
description: Brushing daily is foundational for oral health, reducing risk of cavities and gum disease.

name: Daily Flossing
description: Regular flossing removes plaque and supports healthy gums, lowering long-term oral health risks.

name: Daily Skincare Routine
description: Consistent skincare protects the skin barrier, supports appearance, and reduces long-term damage.

name: Daily Sunscreen Use
description: Daily sunscreen use protects against sunburn, premature aging, and reduces skin cancer risk.

name: Autologous Stem Cell Therapy
description: Stem cell therapies use a person’s own or donor-derived stem cells to promote tissue regeneration, immune modulation, and may slow aspects of aging. Early human studies show benefit for orthopedic, cardiovascular, and immune function, but protocols are experimental and not widely regulated.
agent_goal: Follow autologous stem cell therapy recommendation

name: Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) Injections
description: PRP therapy involves concentrating your own platelets and injecting them into tissues to accelerate repair and reduce inflammation. Used for joints, tendons, hair regrowth, and skin rejuvenation. Data are strongest for orthopedic injury, with early research in anti-aging.

name: Fecal Microbiota Transplantation (FMT)
description: FMT introduces healthy donor gut bacteria into the colon to restore microbiome diversity. Clinically validated for C. difficile infection; under research for metabolic, immune, and neurodegenerative diseases.

name: Exosome Therapy
description: Exosomes are cell-derived vesicles thought to mediate many benefits of stem cells—anti-inflammatory, tissue repair, and cellular communication. Mostly experimental, with pilot evidence for arthritis, skin, and neurological conditions.

name: Young Plasma Exchange / Plasma Dilution
description: “Young blood” or plasma dilution therapies aim to remove pro-aging factors from the blood. Inspired by animal studies, early trials in humans show some improvements in biomarkers, but long-term safety and benefits remain unproven.
agent_goal: Follow young plasma exchange / plasma dilution recommendation

name: Senolytic Drug Protocol (Dasatinib + Quercetin, Fisetin, Navitoclax, etc.)
description: Senolytics are agents that selectively destroy senescent (“zombie”) cells. Dasatinib + quercetin, fisetin, and navitoclax have been studied in animals and early-phase human trials for reducing markers of aging, improving physical function, and organ health.
agent_goal: Follow senolytic drug protocol (dasatinib + quercetin, fisetin, navitoclax, etc.) recommendation

name: Whole-Body Cryotherapy
description: Cryotherapy involves brief exposure to very cold temperatures to reduce inflammation, support recovery, and possibly improve mood/metabolic health. Data strongest for pain/recovery; anti-aging effects are speculative.

name: Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy (HBOT)
description: HBOT exposes the body to pure oxygen at high pressure, promoting tissue repair, stem cell release, and (in small studies) telomere lengthening and improved cognition in aging adults.

name: Photobiomodulation (Red/NIR Light Therapy)
description: Red and near-infrared light exposure is thought to improve mitochondrial function, reduce inflammation, support skin/brain health, and possibly slow aging processes. Data are mixed but growing for cognitive, mood, and skin outcomes.

name: Autophagy/Parabiosis Protocol (fasting-mimetic drugs, plasma exchange, etc.)
description: These protocols seek to stimulate autophagy (cellular recycling), reduce senescent factors, and rejuvenate tissue health. Most are investigational, with benefit/risk still under study.
agent_goal: Practice time-restricted eating or intermittent fasting

name: Continuous Glucose Monitor (CGM)
description: CGMs provide real-time blood sugar data in response to food, exercise, sleep, and stress—empowering personalized optimization and early detection of metabolic risk.

name: Sleep Tracker
description: Sleep trackers (Oura, WHOOP, Apple Watch, etc.) monitor sleep duration, stages, and variability—enabling targeted sleep routines and nudges for recovery.

name: Movement & Activity Tracker
description: Activity trackers (Fitbit, Garmin, Apple, etc.) provide insight on daily steps, activity minutes, heart rate, and support adherence to movement goals.

name: Heart Rate & HRV Monitor
description: Devices that track HR and HRV (Oura, WHOOP, chest straps) help gauge fitness, recovery, and stress response—guiding readiness and recovery protocols.
agent_goal: Follow heart rate & hrv monitor recommendation

name: Blood Pressure Monitor (Home)
description: Home BP monitoring enables early detection of hypertension, tracking trends, and medication adjustment outside clinic visits.

name: Body Composition Analyzer
description: Smart scales and impedance devices help monitor progress in muscle gain, fat loss, and metabolic health for ongoing adjustment.

name: Stress Tracker
description: Wearables and apps estimate stress via HRV, skin conductance, or sleep/activity patterns—surfacing trends and supporting behavioral change.
secondary_biometrics: Skeletal Muscle Mass to Fat-Free Mass

name: Grip Strength Dynamometer
description: Grip strength is a powerful predictor of frailty, resilience, and longevity. Tracking monthly identifies early loss and guides strength recs.
agent_goal: Perform strength training to maintain muscle mass and bone density

name: Smart Pill Dispenser/Medication Tracker
description: Medication trackers help reduce missed doses, ensure therapy success, and provide reminders for prescription or supplement protocols.
agent_goal: Follow smart pill dispenser/medication tracker recommendation
secondary_biometrics: Skeletal Muscle Mass to Fat-Free Mass

name: Sauna Therapy
description: Sauna bathing is linked to reduced cardiovascular, dementia, and all-cause mortality risk—possibly via hormesis, improved vascular function, and stress reduction.
agent_goal: Use sauna therapy for cardiovascular and longevity benefits

name: Cold Exposure / Cold Plunge
description: Cold exposure activates brown fat, boosts mood, may support immune health, and builds resilience via hormesis.

name: HEPA Air Purifier Use
description: Clean indoor air reduces exposure to allergens, pollutants, and improves lung and cognitive health—especially in urban environments.
agent_goal: Follow hepa air purifier use recommendation

name: Blue Light Blocking Protocol
description: Reducing blue light at night supports melatonin production, circadian rhythm, and sleep quality.
agent_goal: Follow blue light blocking protocol recommendation

name: Professional Therapy
description: Working with a licensed therapist helps improve emotional health, reduce stress, and build long-term psychological resilience.

name: Psychedelic-Assisted Therapy
description: Psychedelic-assisted therapy (e.g., ketamine, psilocybin) may promote deep psychological breakthroughs, reduce depression, and support emotional healing.

name: Digital Mental Health Tools
description: Digital mental health apps offer guided support for mood, focus, anxiety, and self-reflection. They expand access to structured tools outside of therapy.
agent_goal: Follow digital mental health tools recommendation

name: Community Engagement
description: Meaningful connection to community—through clubs, faith groups, volunteering, or shared hobbies—supports emotional health, purpose, and even longevity.

name: Purpose & Meaning Work
description: A clear sense of purpose has been linked to better physical and mental health, greater life satisfaction, and lower mortality risk—especially when integrated daily.

name: Financial Wellness Habits
description: Financial stress negatively impacts mental and physical health. Basic money tracking builds control, reduces anxiety, and enables long-term wellbeing and security.
